00040 #ifndef _CHECKPOINT_H
00041 #define _CHECKPOINT_H
00042 
00043 #define CKPT_MAJOR 1
00044 #define CKPT_MINOR 6
00045 
00046 #define CKPT_MINPID 350
00047 
00048 #define RECOVER_TERMIOS
00049 
00050 #include <asm/ptrace.h>
00051 #include <linux/ipc.h> 
00052 #include <asm/param.h>
00053 
00054 /* Bitwise definition:    
00055    bit  0 = 0 - One process,          1 - All children 
00056    bit  1 = 0 - Continue,             1 - Kill
00057    bit  2 = 0 - W/Shared Library,     1 - W/O Shared Library
00058    bit  3 = 0 - W/Common components   1 - W/O Common components
00059    bits 4-7 = Unused 
00060 */
00061 #define CKPT_PARAM_SIZE sizeof(struct ckpt_param)
00062 
00063 #define CKPT_MAX_FILENAME               256
00064 
00065 /* Values ckpt_param::flags can take */
00066 #define CKPT_NOWAIT                     0x01 
00067 #define CKPT_KILL                       0x02 
00068 #define CKPT_NO_SHARED_LIBRARIES        0x04 
00069 #define CKPT_NO_BINARY_FILE             0x08 
00070 
00071 #define RESTART_STOP                    0x01 // STOP after restarted
00072 #define RESTART_NOTIFY                  0x02 // Notify after restarted
00073 
00074 /* Type of file descriptor encountered: */
00075 #define CKPT_DUP                        0
00076 #define CKPT_FILE                       1
00077 #define CKPT_PIPE                       2
00078 #define CKPT_SOCK                       3
00079 #define CKPT_OTHER                      4
00080 
00081 /* IOCTL commands */
00082 #define CKPT_MAGIC 0xCC
00083 
00084 #define CKPT_IOCTL_CHECKPOINT            _IOW(CKPT_MAGIC, 1, struct ckpt_param)
00085 #define CKPT_IOCTL_RESTART               _IOW(CKPT_MAGIC, 2, struct ckpt_param)
00086 
00087 #define CKPT_MAX_IOC_NR 2
00088 
00089 /* Networking ioctls un-impl.
00090 #define CKPT_IOCTL_CHANGE_REMOTE_ADDR    102
00091 #define CKPT_IOCTL_FREEZE_SOCK           103
00092 #define CKPT_IOCTL_ACTIVATE_SOCK         104
00093 */
00094

00096 #define CKPT_DEV_FILE    "/dev/ckpt"

00103 #define NR_syscalls 326

00133 struct header {

00200     struct {
00201       int dupfd;
00202     } dup;    
00203 
00205     struct {
00206       unsigned long inode; 
00207       int lock; 
00208       unsigned blocked:1;
00209       unsigned rdwr:1; 
00210     } pipes;
00211 
00213     struct {
00214       unsigned long int file_pos;
00215       unsigned long file; 
00216       int flags;
00217       int mode;
00218       char *filename;
00219     } file;
00220 
00222     struct {
00223       int domain;
00224       int type;
00225       int protocol;
00226       int state;
00227       int reuse;
00228       unsigned int saddr, daddr;
00229       unsigned sport, dport;
00230       unsigned short backlog;
00231     } sock;
00232   } u;
00233 };

00246 // to be safe currently we don't allow checkpointing processes with PID
00247 // < CKPT_MINPID.
00248 inline int ckptable(struct task_struct * p) {
00249   return (p->pid > CKPT_MINPID);
00250 }

00255 inline int ckpt_pgd_bad(pgd_t pgd)              { return 0; }
00256 inline int ckpt_pgd_present(pgd_t pgd)  { return 1; }

00264 ckpt_pmd_offset(pgd_t * dir, unsigned long address) { return (pmd_t *)dir; }

00290 // other helper funcitons

00292 // these are just stolen from some kernel headers (unfortunately they have
00293 // "extern" in the header so we can not directly use.  Also we need to
00294 // worry about locking.
00295 
00296 inline struct task_struct *ckpt_find_task_by_pid(int pid) {
00297   return find_task_by_pid(pid);
00298 }

00300 static inline int ckpt_strncmp(const char * src, const char * dest, int size) {
00301   int i;
00302   for (i = 0; i < size; i++) {
00303     if (src[i] != dest[i])
00304       return 1;
00305     if (src[i] == 0)
00306       break;
00307   }
00308 
00309   return 0;
00310 }
00311 
00312 static inline void ckpt_strncpy(char * src, const char * dest, int size) {
00313   int i;
00314   for (i = 0; i < size; i++) {
00315     src[i] = dest[i];
00316   }
00317 }
00318 
00319 static inline int ckpt_strlen(char* str) {
00320   int size = 0;
00321   while (str[size] != 0)
00322     size++;
00323 
00324   return size;
00325 }
00326 
00327 /*
00328  * Check whether the specified task has the fd open. Since the task
00329  * may not have a files_struct, we must test for p->files != NULL.
00330  *
00331  * copied from linux/file.h
00332  */
00333 inline struct file * fcheck_task(struct task_struct *p, unsigned int fd) {
00334         struct file * file = NULL;
00335 
00336         if (p->files && fd < p->files->fdt->max_fds)
00337                 file = p->files->fdt->fd[fd];
00338         return file;
00339 }
00340 
00341 static inline struct inode *
00342 ckpt_icheck_task(struct task_struct *p, unsigned int fd) {
00343 
00344   struct file *fdes = fcheck_task(p, fd);
00345   struct dentry *dent = fdes ? fdes->f_dentry : NULL;
00346   struct inode *inode = dent ? dent->d_inode : NULL;
00347   return inode;
00348 }
